intro: Hieracium microcodon, commonly known as the small-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and flies. Hieracium microcodon is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
